inn1.comm: back of a length and just a shade outside off, blocked back to the bowler, rather punchily
similar length and outside off, the ball does not come onto the bat. Pushed into the covers
good length ball around off, Azhar steps forward and then across as he clips it to midwicket
pitched further up and on the fourth-stump line, blocked back to the bowler
keeps it on a back of a length and outside off, pushed past the covers, beats mid-off to his left and opens his account with a couple
gentle back-of-a-length offering outside off, Azhar waits on it before gliding it past the lone slip fielder
inauspicious start from Taskin. He sprays this miles wide outside off, ignored by Azhar
back of a length and on middle and leg, tucked away behind square on the leg side
very full on the pads, flicked away backward of square leg and he gets off the mark
back of a length and comes in a touch on off, Azhar camps on the back foot and punches it back to Taskin
dug in on a back of a length and just outside off, punched with an angled bat to backward point
good length ball tails in on off, Azhar closes his bat face and works it in the gap between midwicket and mid-on
shortish and width on offer as well, Azhar cashes in his cheque as he cuts it firmly, beats a diving backward point to his left and third man, running to his right
pitched up and outside off, tapped to backward point with an open face
back of a length and on middle and leg, Asam shuffles across a bit and works it in front of midwicket
dragged short and wide outside off, Aslam shifts his balance onto the back foot and cuts it away past backward point
good length ball around off, he shimmies down the track and nurdles a single in front of mid-on
veering onto the leg stump to the left-hander. Nudged wide of square leg for another alert single
fuller and outside off, Azhar opens the face of his bat and directs it towards point
back of a length and just outside off, he checks his punch and manages an inside edge, lobs it into the flap of his front pad
beautifully played, that's his first four in international cricket. Short and outside off, he swivels on the back foot and pulls it behind the square leg umpire
back of a length and down leg, wide called, Aslam can't connect with the glance
fullish and outside off, Aslam drives it, backward point dives to his right and stops the ball
fuller and drifting onto the pads, clipped to midwicket

banged in short and climbs onto the left-hander. He takes his eyes off the ball for a brief while, but fetched it from outside off, flipped his wrists and pulled it backward of square leg again. Tamim runs across from long leg in vain
this is even better. Taskin overcorrects as he pushes this too full and outside off, he leans forward and drives it crisply past mid-off, scudded away to the boundary
Mashrafe claims the outside edge but it dies in front of widish slip. On a good length and outside off, Azhar shimmies down the track, pushes and gets an outside edge, which does not carry to Sarkar
fuller and on middle and off, defended to mid-on
good length ball around off, he opens the face of his bat and dabs it in front of point, straight to the fielder
on a length and outside off, tapped to short point
fuller and outside off, Azhar allows the ball to come to him and then steers it deftly to third man
back of a  length ball on middle and leg, he shuffles forward and across as he pushes it back to the bowler
full on middle and leg, worked to midwicket
Azhar shimmies forward, shuffles across and turns it to leg
dropped short and outside off, sits up. Asam rocks back and pulls it away past short midwicket, beats the chasing mid-on fielder as well
slid through on the fourth-stump line, too close to cut. He manages to chop it away past slip, runs away to the boundary. Nasir has his hands on his head
straight roller on off, defended to off side
darted quicker on middle and off, poked out in front of the covers
good length ball outside off, Azhar takes a step forward and pats it to point
back of a length and on middle and leg, Azhar steps out again, this time tucking it out towards deep backward square leg
fuller and on the pads, nudged to short midwicket
dug in shortish and down leg, Aslam swivels and helps it away to deep fine leg with a pull. Finds the fielder
back of a length and outside off, he can't cut it properly. Sort of chops it away past short point to backward point
Azhar chips down the track, the bowler drags his length back. Punched to mid-off, straight to the fielder
dug in shortish and outside off, he stands up tall and punches it. But he can't thread the gap on the off side
similar length, wider outside off, he sits back, punches and finds backward point

short and wide outside off again, Azhar shifts his balance into the back foot and cuts it in front of square. Mahmudullah at a shortish-point position takes some pace off the ball, yet it runs away to the boundary
full and outside off, guided to third man
pitched further up and outside off, almost a half-volley length. He bends his knee and crunches a drive past the covers
length ball on middle, Aslam shuffles forward and across as he defends it back to the bowler
back of a length and moves in a touch from outside off. Azhar pushes with his feet in cement, gets it to mid-on off the inside half of the bat. They steal a single, courtesy alert running
slowy full ball on middle, he reads it and dabs it gently to the off side
back of a length and on middle, he shuffles across and coaxes it behind the square leg umpire for one
Azhar steps forward and manufactures a short ball outside off, punched past the bowler to mid-off
shot! Dug in short and wide outside off he stays on the back foot and cuts it past short point. Mahmudullah can't intercept it
Azhar takes a couple of pace forward and tucks this back-of-a-length ball to the leg side
dropped shortish and outside off, he looks to play off the back foot. Mistimed cut to extra-cover
fuller and on off, pushed to the right of short point
Azhar sinks to one knee, takes it from off and sweeps it away to deep square leg
Tossed up on off with some extra bounce, Aslam tries to paddle it away. He may have got an inside edge onto the pad
floated up, defended

Aslam looks to paddle, lobs it through to leg slip. Smart catch from Tamim. Big appeal from Bangladesh, but it amounts to nothing. Tamim wants a review. The ball looped off the pad, Tamim followed the ball, tumbled back and pouched a brilliant catch. No glove involved. Pitched outside leg, so no chances of giving it out via lbw. Bangladesh's review ends in vain
very full and tails in on off, he squeezes out a drive to mid-on. Azhar did not account for the inward movement
fuller and on middle and leg, he leans across and flicks it beautifully between midwicket and mid-on
banged in short and wide outside off, he gets on top of the bounce and punches it out to deep point
bouncer down leg, Asam can't connect with the pull, wide called
slowish full ball on off, Aslam spots it and defends it to the covers
dug in shortish and outside off, pulled away to deep midwicket. Not middled
back of a length and on off, he hops up and eases it to long leg for one
flatter and hurries on off, jabbed back at the bowler, who deflects it back onto the non-strikers' end. Aslam had backed up a bit, but was home
much slower through the air, patted through point
darted quicker and around off, too close to cut, chopped towards short third man
fuller and on off, chopped towards point now
Nasir drags his length back, punched to midwicket
pushed through on off and he gets some spin away, poked into the covers
tossed up and full on off, driven to the covers
arm ball arrowed in on off, he rocks back and cuts it away to sweeper cover
he gives this more air, Aslam comes down the track and blocks it quietly to the covers
flatter and on the off stump, Aslam whips it away to long-on
arm-ball curves in with the angle. He doesn't know how he bowls, but he bowls so well. Raps Azhar on the back pad after beating the inside edge, but this was snaking down leg
he lobs this up around off and gets it to turn away, the batsman employs soft hands and dabs it to the off side
fuller and on the pads, he hangs back and works it in front of midwicket
pushed through, blocked back
Aslam uses his feet, meets the pitch of this flighted ball and chips it in front of vacant mid-off. There is protection in the deep, though
fuller and on middle, down the track and driven to long-on
tossed up outside off, he is down on one knee as he lifts it over the covers, beats long-off running to his right
fullish and well-flighted outside off, he nips down the track and goes over mid-off to round off the over
angled in on middle, down the track and flicked over short midwicket. Long-on hunts it down
arm-ball angled in on middle, now its Azhar's turn to come down the track and drive it to long-off
picked away off the pads in front of square on the leg side
fuller and on off, Azhar chips down the track and drills a drive to long-off
tossed up nicely, he miscues the attempted chip in the air. Drops into vacant mid-on - no man's land
quicker and comes in with the angle on off, he looks to cut but has to settle with a chop to extra-cover
fuller and outside off, driven to wide mid-off
Azhar steps out, the bowler drags his length back. Punched quietly down to long-on for a single
slid through on off, he hangs back and defends it back to the bowler
looped up on off, he waits on it, opens the face of his bat and dabs it towards short third man
on a length and outside off, he hunts for a reverse-sweep, hit high on the bat in front of short fine
tossed up and full, patted in front of point with an open face for one
flatter and quicker outside off, jammed back at the bowler
he skips down the track, meets the pitch of the ball and drives it down towards long-off
angled in on off, he goes down on one knee and sweeps it in front of square on the leg side
length on off and middle, milked down to long-off
flatter and quicker outside off, mishit drive into the covers
Azhar steps out, gets a very full ball. Yet he manages to whip his wrists and play it down to long-on
flighted on middle, he steps out and defends it back to Nasir
slid through short on off as he sees the batsman come down the track. Punched back at the bowler
fuller on middle and leg, ticked to square leg
straight ball on middle, driven down to long-on
extra bounce on this back-of-a-length ball on off, spins away late. Blocked in front of the covers

Aslam has nicked off or has he?. The crowd find their voice again. Pushed through a bit outside off, spins away as well, leaving Aslam prodding. The keeper pouches it. And it is given, though there was no outside edge on that. Aslam did not review. Azhar should have insisted on the review. Actually, replays show that the ball grazed the bottom thumb on its way to Mushfiq
tossed up, pushed past the covers for one
tossed up on middle, blocked back
slower through the air, he uses his feet and drives it to the covers
flatter length ball, defended
pushed through on middle and leg, blocked to leg
dropped short, Hafeez rocks back and punches it past the covers and gets off the mark
slid through shortish and outside off, mistimed cut. Chopped into the covers
fullish and floated on off, pushed defensively to the left of the bowler
fuller and outside off, he leans forward and laces it towards sweeper cover
flighted around off, Azhar charges down the track, gets close to the pitch of the ball, extends his arms and lofts it over the covers
flatter and quicker, driven past a diving short cover to long-off
Hafeez is down the track, Sunny slips in the arm ball and shackles Hafeez. Blocked back to the bowler
second fifty in the series for Azhar. Flatter and quicker, flicked past midiwicket. Can he convert it today?

Mohammad Hafeez stretches his arms, drags his bat and makes his ground. He had come down the track earlier, the bowler pulled his length back. Hafeez adjusted and pushed it to cover. He was a tad late to turn back and drag his bat on. The fielder nailed a direct hit, but Hafeez had made his crease
drifts in and rips across the outside edge. That's a peach
pushed through quick as Hafeez looks to come down the track, chopped to the off side
slower through the air, blocked
dug in shortish and outside off, he goes on the back foot and punches it away to sweeper
slider on the leg stump, whipped away through midwicket. Taskin I guess runs across from deep square leg, dives and just about pulls the ball in

bowled em! Sunny breaks into a nice, little jig. Arm-ball arrows in with the angle at 80.8ks, Hafeez skips down the track, does not meet the pitch of the ball and does not connect with his attempted big hit over the leg side. The ball slides in and crashes onto middle and leg
flat on the leg stump, Haris nips down the track straightaway and whips it to long-on
floated up and drifts in with the angle, he manages an inside edge to short fine
flatter and Sunny drags his length back a bit as Azhar comes down the track, takes it on the pad
punched to the covers with an open face, finds the fielder
short and outside off, he stands tall and still, punches it down to long-on
angled in on off, Azhar waits on it before dabbing it in front of point
arm-ball, blocked to short cover
darted short and wide outside off, round-armish, Azhar rocks back and slaps it to sweeper cover
shortish and on off, punched out to the leg side off the back foot
snakes in with the angle on a back of a length, Azhar hangs on the back foot and punches it to short cover
quicker outside off, he offers the full face of the bat as he pushes it down to long-off
straight ball on middle and leg, worked to midwicket
slides in on off and middle, he rolls his wrists on the slog-sweep and sends it to deep square leg
looped up on off, he uses his feet and blocks it
straighter in line, punched back to the bowler
much slower through the air, Haris advances down the track and milks a single down to long-on
Haris steps away, the bowler follows him outside leg. Takes it on the pad
whipped away off the pads to the right of deep midwicket
flatter back of a length and on middle and leg, flicked to leg
on the pads again, whipped to square leg
fuller and round-armed on middle and leg, whipped to deep midwicket
much slower through the air, angled in just outside off. Azhar goes low for a slog-sweep, miscues it in front of deep backward square leg
fuller and on off, he uses his feet and lofts it over mid-off, one-bounce four
flatter and quicker, he misses the slog sweep and takes it on the front pad. Not given, impact outside off
extra bounce on this quicker one, turned to the leg side
flighted and outside off, driven down to long-off
Smartly done! Pushed through outside off, Azhar shuffles across the stumps, waits on it, employs the latest of dabs to the deep third man boundary
fuller and on middle and leg, tucked away to deep midwicket for one
angled in outside off, Azhar advances down the track, check-drives it past the covers all along the ground
flatter on middle and leg, worked to leg
whipped to midwicket
flighted on middle, Haris is down the track as he flicks it through midwicket
dropped short and wide outside off, mistimed cut to short covers
pushed through outside off with some extra bounce, dabbed to point
starts off poorly. Full toss on middle, he clubs it over the deep midwicket fielder. Not middled, but that had to be put away for a six
fuller and on middle and leg, drilled down the track to long-on
lobbed up on off, down the track and driven to long-off
straight ball outside off, which is pushed down to long-off for a jogged single
legbreak outside off, cracked to point, straight to Mahmudullah
fuller and on middle, down the track and drilled to long-off
arm ball on middle and leg, clipped away behind the square leg umpire
back of a length and on middle, he hangs back and punches it towards wide long-on
Haris uses his feet and drives a single down to long-off
Haris milks a single down to long-off
round-armed in on middle, blocked back to the bowler
pushed through outside off, Azhar aims to cut it away, only manages a bottom-edge on it, rolls to the off side
tossed up full, down the track and driven back to the bowler as Haris nearly yorked himself
driven down the ground for one
pushed through flatter and quicker, he uses his feet, pushes and gets a thick outside edge to the off side
Azhar Ali steps away, makes room and lifts this length-ball inside-out over the covers. Superb connection
Azhar Ali nips down the track, the bowler pulls his length back. Punched to long-on
darted shortish, now it is the turn of Haris to come down the track and punch it to long-on
pitched up and outside off, Haris leans forward and drives it beautifully past the covers. Away she whistled to the boundary
shortish and on middle and leg, punched away past midwicket
back of  a length and outside off, he goes on the back foot and cuts it away to the left of backward point. Defeats third man, running to his right. Impressive timing and placement from Azhar
on a length and too wide outside off, carved away to deep third man
on a length and outside off, he waits on it and steers it to deep third man
Rubel pulls the pace off this length ball outside off, Azhar shuffles across off and wristily pushes it to mid-on
back of a length, punched to the left of the bowler. Mahmudullah moves to his left, gets a the boot in the way and stops the ball
similar length and turning across off, punched to cover off the back foot
similar ball, similar shot. Punched to cover
on the shorter side again, Haris arches back and cracks it to sweeper cover
flatter and on middle and leg, Azhar sinks to one knee and sweeps it behind square leg. Nasir runs across to his right from deep square leg, makes good ground, slides and keeps it to two
angled on middle and leg, fuller in length, worked to short fine leg
Azhar rides the bounce of this short ball outside off and steers it to deep third man with an angled bat
Rubel bends his back and bangs a 134.4ks bumper that climbs over leg. Haris sinks under it
short on middle, he uses his feet, aims for a half swipe, half pull and gets a top edge to third man
back of a length and outside off, guided to third man
shortish and on middle and leg, he swivels on the back foot and pulls it away towards deep midwicket
dug in on a back of a length and outside off, sits up to be hit. Azhar obliges as he crashes a cut to the backward point point boundary. Sweeper can't cut that off
slid through on off, too close to cut, chopped to short third man
blocked back to the bowler
Haris uses his feet, takes it on the full and bunts it to long-off
on a length and on middle and leg, he uses his feet, clips it in front of square on the leg side. He hares across for the second, beating Nasir's throw
tossed up on middle and leg, he nudges a single behind square leg
picked away off the pads to deep midwicket
floated outside leg as Haris moves around in the crease. Tucked towards deep midwicket and they pick another two
back of a length and on the leg stump, beats Haris' defensive push and raps him high on the back pad

fuller on middle and leg, he skips out and taps it back to the bowler. Sunny effects a direct hit at the strikers'. Haris had drifted out a bit, but makes his ground comfortably. The TV umpire confirms it as well
Haris aims to shuffle across, whips this leg-stumpish ball through midwicket
tossed up and full, down the track and driven back. Sunny aims to collect the ball quickly and fire another throw at the strikers' but the ball bobbled out
Sunny gives this more air outside off and keeps it out, Azhar comes forward and presses it towards the covers
good length ball outside off, he takes it from there and turns it with the wrists in front of an onrushing long-on. He does not gather the ball cleanly
dug in on a back of a length and on off, he takes a couple of paces forward and tucks a single through backward square leg
fuller and on the pads, he eases a drive to long-on for one
Azhar advances down the track, Mash is wary of it as he drags his length back to beat the former on the flick. He takes it high on the front pad
Azhar steps out and squeezes it wide of short fine leg off the inside half of the bat. Diving stop from Rubel
shortish and outside off, Haris closes his bat face and mishits a punchy stroke back to the Mash
arm-ball angled in on middle, punched to wide long-on. They run across for the second
darted very full on middle and leg, jabbed down to long-on as Azhar moves to 98
flatter and outside off, he goes low to slog sweep. Drags it off the bottom of the bat  to square leg
flat again on the leg stump, he uses his feet and whips it up and over long-on. The fielder leaps and goes over the ropes in vain
spinning in, tucked away off the pads to deep midwicket
darted flatter and quicker, whipped to mid-off
good length ball outside off at 111.8ks, slowy, Haris seeks to dab it away but is beaten soundly
back of a length, he comes forward and taps it to point
length ball outside off, he uses his wrists and turns it to mid-on for one. Azhar Ali on 99
dragged shortish and outside off, punched away to long-on
good length ball outside off, punchily driven to short cover, who dives to his left to stop the ball

good length ball outside off, he shuffles across, steps out, twirls his wrists and flicks it wide of midwicket for his maiden ODI century. He pumps his fist, leaps, swings his bat in the air and later performs the sajda. He is the first Pakistan captain since Afridi in 2010 to make an ODI ton
shortish, punched back at the bowler
darted quicker and on off, Haris hangs back and punches it back at the bowler.
punched down to long-on. Fifty for Haris

Shakib strikes with the arm-ball. This was angled in with some good extra bounce. Azhar shifts his balance onto the back foot in an attempt to cut it away. It was far too close to play the stroke and Azhar failed to connect. Shakib hits the top of off. His joy may translate as you miss and I hit. Azhar slams his bat on the ground as he trudges back
flighted and on middle and leg, tapped down to mid-on and he gets off the mark
on a length and outside off, he comes down the track and hits it over the covers

two wickets in two overs. Bangladesh are clawing their way back into the contest. Haris sinks to one knee and aims for a swipe across the line, slices it high into the air behind the wicket. Mushfiq follows the ball, moves to his left and swallows it. He was hoodwinked by a slower one
back of a length and comes in, Rizwan wants to cut it away, chops it behind the wicket for a scampered single
Fawad comes down the track, Mortaza is wary of it as he bangs a bumper, flies over to the keeper. Wide called for height
back of a length and on middle, Fawad shuffles across in his own inimitable way, dabs it to point for single and gets off the mark. The fielder (Shakib) did not collect the ball cleanly
dug in short and wide outside off, he takes it from there and hammers a pull, but finds deep midwicket
Faward has a shimmy down the track, Mash pulls his length back, dabbed quietly to point
lobbed up outside off, Riwan stretches forward and drives it past the covers
he uses his feet, does not meet the pitch of the ball and pushes it back to the bowler
tossed up and full outside off, whipped to long-on
slid through on middle and leg with some turn, poked out to point
how soft was that? Slower through the air from Shakib, stops on Rizwan who aims to flick it away. But he can only lob it back to the bowler. Make that three wickets in three overs for Bangladesh
fuller and on middle and leg, pushed to the right of the bowler
back of a length and on middle, he shuffles across and dabs it in front of point for a hustled single. The fielder dives forward swoops down on the ball, but misses the direct-hit
shortish and outside off, he hops up, gets on top of the bounce and steers it to third man
very full and darted on middle, he jams it past the covers for a quick single. Mid-off has it covered
full and outside off, he reaches out for a drive. The ball may have died in front of a diving backward point
Fawad comes down the track, Mash delivers a bouncer at 130ks. Pulls and misses. Wide called
length delivery on middle, blocked in front of point. He seeks for a drop-and-run single but is sent back
112.6ks slower ball, well-disguised by Mash. Fawad was early into his stroke and nearly chipped it back to the Bangladesh captain
flighted and on off, slapped in the air over the covers. Long-off runs across to his left and cuts it off
tossed up, angled in on middle, down the track and slammed over mid-on, who was in the circle. Good awareness of the field
flatter on middle, defended
tossed up, he stretches forward and dabs it to point
fullish and around off, tapped to point
angled in on off, slower through the air, dead-batted

Crude slog from Fawad, superb take from Nasir. It had Mash applauding. Length-ball, Alam goes low to swipe it away, does so though without much power. Nasir runs across to his left from deep square leg, completes the catch and tumbles!
bouncer outside off, left alone
back of a length, outside off, cut away to third man
fullish and outside off, Wahab bends his knee and slices it to deep third man
short and outside off, he rocks back and pulls it away to the deep midwicket boundary. Nasir Hossan dives across, gets a hand onto it, but can't prevent the boundary
slower ball outside off at 106ks, driven past a diving short cover to mid-off for one
long-hop on the leg stump, he rocks back and pulls it over midwicket
tossed up and outside off, guided to short third
flatter length ball, Rizwan slogs and gets an inside edge that wanders away to the leg side
arm-ball on middle on a back of a length, pushed to short cover
too full and outside off, drilled past the covers
Shakib loops this up on off. Wahab does not catch the bait. Defends it gently to short cover
good length ball, skids through to Wahab Riaz, who thrusts his front pad across and misses the flick. This was sliding down leg
yorker length on middle and leg, dug out in front of square leg
back of a length on off as Rizwan takes a couple of paces forward, pushed to backward point with an open face
slower short ball outside off, Wahab fetches it from there and pulls it away to the deep midwicket boundary. Sarkar dives to his left in the deep but the ball wins the race
Wahab makes a bit of room outside leg, Rubel follows him and strikes him on the pad
Wahab picks out Mashrafe at cover. This was a length-ball outside off, Wahab backs away, drives uppishly and hits it straight to Mash, who did not even budge
tossed up and angled in on middle, blocked to the leg side
pushed through, he uses his feet and drives it down to long-off
shortish and angled across, cut to the man at point

A huge mix-up and Umar Gul gone for a duck on his return to international cricket. He hangs back and pushes it to short cover. Shakib collects the ball quickly and throws it to the bowlers'. Sunny gathers it and flicks it onto the stumps. Gul is well short after a communication breakdown
fuller and driven down to long-off
angled in on middle, slower through the air, chipped in front of the bowler
good length slower-ball on middle at 114.4ks, he waits on it and pats it to the off side. Nasim can't manufacture his own pace
length on middle, he backs away and flays it to the covers
Rubel has his hands aloft in joy. Holes out to Taskin at mid-off. This was fuller and outside off, Nasim looks to loft over the covers. End up mistiming it straight to mid-off
slash and a miss to a back-of-a-length ball outside off
full toss on middle at 141.2ks, hurrying the batsman, who hops up and pushes it to mid-on
length on off, he stands tall and drills it to the covers
flighted on off, he takes the aerial route. Does not middle it as wide long-on mops it
flatter and around off, pushed back to the bowler
quicker and outside off, he bends down and drags a slog-sweep to deep midwicket

Have Pakistan been bowled out? Looped up outside off, he swings and misses as he loses his balance. But he managed to drag his back foot back by the time the keeper whipped the bails off. the TV umpire confirms it as well, Babar is safe
dropped short and wide outside off, he rocks back and cuts it past short cover
Now, Pakistan have been bowled out for 250. This was fired at 92.5ks, Junaid attempts a dinky reverse-sweep but does not connect with it. This darter clatters into middle and leg

inn2.comm: nice and loopy outside off, Tamim stretches forward and drives it to the right of long-off
slid through outside off, Sarkar waits on the back foot, uses the pace of the bowler and runs it away past slip
pushed through on a back of a length, pushed towards mid-off
flatter on the leg stump, keeps low, worked to short midwicket off the inside part of the bat
too full and on the pads, whipped away behind square leg
tossed up close to off, Tamim dead-bats it to the off side
fuller and darted across off, he drives with his feet glued to the crease, gets a thickish edge that beats a diving Rizwan
short and on middle, blocked to mid-off off the back foot
Umar errs down the leg side, Rizwan flings to his right to stop the ball
straighter in line, he comes on the front foot and drives it to mid-off
Umar Gul drifts another one down leg. Talk about rustiness. Gul has not played an ODI since December 2014
back of a length and on the hips, worked to midwicket
fuller and wider outside off, he punches it straight to short cover. Not middled
shortish and hurries on middle at 82mph, Sarkar hops up and fends it back to the bowler
straighter on middle, defended to mid-on off the front foot
looped up, shortens the length, down the track and check-pushed back to the bowler
blocked to short cover off the back foot
round-armish, full on middle and leg, nudged to the leg side for one
off-break on middle, driven causally to long-off
Tamim is down the track, Hafeez pulls his length back. The former does not meet the pitch of the ball and takes it on his thigh pad
back of a length and on off, Sarkar hacks it over midwicket. Not off the sweet spot, but good enough to get four
similar length and on the hips, he picks it up from there and whips it over midwicket. This one was more convicing
back of a length and skids through outside off at 134ks, mistimes the drive and squirts it to the off side
back of a length and on middle and off, he hangs on the back foot and punches it to mid-off
indecisive from Sarkar. Umar Gul slips in a slower ball angled across off, Sarkar was looking to spar at it before belatedly bailing out
fractionally back of a length and on off, he stands nice and balanced as he punches it to the right of mid-off. Azhar has it covered, diving to his right
fuller and on middle, he drills a drive to the covers
quicker and on middle, pushed back to the bowler
he loops this one up on middle, carefully blocked to the off side
length ball on middle and off, he inches forward and pats it to the covers
darted flatter on middle and leg, cramps Sarkar for room.  Jammed back to the bowler, he did not have enough room to go inside out
skiddy ball comes in on middle, too close to cut. Sarkar just about manages to chop it to the off side
back of a length and angling away outside off, Tamim shoulders arms
Ctrl+C, Ctrl+V of the previous ball. Left alone
fullish and angling away, this one is closer to off. Still does not interest Tamim
back of a length and skiddy on middle and off, not much swinging room. Chopped in front of point
back of a length on middle, keeps a tad low. Tamim adjusts and blocks it back to the bowler
Tamim breaks the maiden. Dug in short and outside off, Tamim's eyes lit up as he rocked back and pulled it firmly over midwicket. Sped away to the boundary
fuller ball on middle, driven down to long-off
fuller on the stumps, driven back at the bowler
flatter and on middle and leg, down the track and dragged to mid-on off the inside half
shortish, punched to midwicket off the back foot
lobbed up on middle, driven to the covers
straight roller on middle, blocked back to the bowler
back of a length and holds its line on middle, he wafts and gets a thick inside edge to short fine leg
back of a length and slanting away outside off, bounces over the attempted flashy cut

very full and on middle and off, he does not drive properly as the ball goes only as far as mid-off. They hustle across for a single. The fielder fails to effect a direct hit. Could have been close...
Tamim gives the charge, the bowler pulls his length back and angles it away. Swings and meets only with thin air
back of a length and on middle at 130.5ks, tucked through midwicket
119.2ks full ball on the pads, he waits on it and works it through midwicket for a jogged single
good length and moves away outside off with the angle, beats the outside edge of Tamim
length on off, Sarkar nips down the track and drags it over midwicket off the inside half of the bat
tossed up on middle, he backs away a bit and drives it towards mid-off
slid through, blocked back to the bowler
quicker on middle and leg, defended from the crease
tapped in front of point
fuller and on middle and leg, he manages to get under it and hoist it over long-on for a flattish six. Mid-on was in the circle and could only watch the ball go over
back of a length on middle, tucked to the leg side
dug in on a back of a length and outside off, punched to extra-cover
back of a length and on middle and leg, shovelled away to deep midwicket with plenty of bottom-hand power
back of a length and on top of middle, he camps on the back foot and chops it behind point
on a length and on middle and leg, half paddled and half pulled away to the right of short fine leg
length-ball on off, Tamim charges down the track, and drags it back to the bowler off the inner part of the bat
Wahab bounds in, drops his towel. Delivers a shortish ball outside off, steered away to third man
back of a length on the hips, he hops up and flicks it behind square on the leg side
back of a length and on off, he stands tall and punches it past backward point, but it is cut off in the deep
drifting down leg, he does not meet with the glance. Off the pad and the ball wanders away to long leg
slowy short ball at 112.9ks, tentatively pulled backward of square leg
banged in shortish and outside off at 143.2ks, he gets on top of the bounce punching crisply it to sweeper cover
gives the charge first ball. Shortish and outside off, Tamim is down the track as he mishits this back to Junaid
back of a length and on middle, turned to midwicket
Sarkar gives the charge and hacks it away to mid-on. Umar Gul dives to his right and deflects it to mid-off
low full toss on middle, duly put away behind square on the leg side with a flick of the wrists. Long leg can't run across in time and prevent the four
back of a length and outside off, down the track and flat-batted to mid-off. Not much power behind that stroke. Azhar did not collect the ball cleanly either
dug in on a back-of-a-length and on the fourth-stump line, punched to short cover
top, top strike from Tamim. Short and climbs outside off, Tamim leaps with it, cutting it up and over backward point, Nearly went all the way
back of a length on middle and leg, worked to midwicket
picked away off the hips towards deep backward square leg for one. Deep square leg runs across and mops it up
bouncer down leg at 144ks, too quick to connect with the pull. But the line is awry
back of a length and hurries onto the leg stump, he stays back and manages an inside edge onto the pad

lifter outside off at 141kps, boings to the keeper after the batsman fails to ramp it away. Wahab's muffled appeal is turned down. Pakistan do not go for the review. There was no nick on that, no glove either
Sarkar opens the face of his bat on impact with this short one outside off and guides it to deep third man
back of a length and angling away outside off, he rocks on the back foot and slaps it away past backward point, fizzes away to the boundary
back of a length and outside off, he stands tall and forces it to sweeper cover
too full and straight, he tucks it behind the square leg umpire for one
too straight again, clipped away to the left of short midwicket. Deep square leg runs to his right to collect the ball
back of a length and skids on outside off at 137.3ks, chopped to third man
dug in short and outside off, Sarkar aims to pull and only connects with thin air
fuller and on middle and leg, clipped to the man at short midwicket
Wahab drops the towel in his followthrough, dabbed to deep third man
back of a length and on middle, he is happy to camp on the back foot and punch it to point
back of a length and angling away outside off, Sarkar throws his bat at it, but can't slice it away. Beaten
shortish and climbs on off, he gets on top of the bounce and dabs it to point
drifting down leg, helped to long leg
shortish and climbs over off as Sarkar pulls and does not connect. The mild caught-behind cry is turned down
length on middle, driven to mid-off
pitched up, stops on the batsman, who chips it to the right of the bowler, towards mid-off
back of a length on off, he seeks to punch it away. Gets an inside edge that dribbles behind square on the leg side
back of a length and outside off, Tamim looks to lash it through the covers. He adjusts his stroke and steers it to deep point
very full and straight, Tamim leans across and whips it through midwicket
shortish and skiddy outside off, Tamim angles his bat and guides it past a diving backward point to deep third man
veering onto the hips, tucked away to deep backward square leg
good length ball angled in on middle, poked out in front of midwicket. This may have stopped on the batsman
back of a length and straight in line, defended to the left of Wahab
strays on the pads again, eased down to long leg
back of a length and angled in at 143.2ks, he is late to bring his bat down but manages an inside edge in front of square and trots off to the other end
Has Rizwan dropped Sarkar? Angled in from round the stumps and turns away, he pokes and gets a feather onto it. Rizwan grabbed at it with hard hands and put it down
chipped to the left of the bowler
fuller and on middle and leg, turned to midwicket
Hafeez pushes this through, down the track and takes it on the pad. Oh wait, Tamim got an inside edge on the pad
Tamim aims to work this to leg, gets a leading edge wide of the covers
looped up outside off, he comes forward and nudged it to mid-on
pushed through and shortens his length, down the track and blocked back
flighted and outside off, turned through midwicket for a fifty
good connection. He bends down, takes it on the full and reverse-sweeps it past a diving backward point
angled on the pads, worked in front of square on the leg side
quicker on middle and leg, nudged in front of midwicket for one. Two fielders converge on the ball
flatter and on middle, he uses his feet and wallops it away past the covers
slid through outside off with extra bounce, chopped to point
down the wicket, drifting onto the pad. Sarkar looks to sneak in a leg bye but is sent back and beats the throw from short midwicket I guess
flat on middle and leg, punched down to long-on
fuller on middle, he puts his bat in front of the pad and defends solidly
very full and on off, driven down to long-off
angled on the pad, he pads it away behind square on the leg side. Dead ball, for he did not attempt a shot there
tossed up and spins in, beats the defensive push and struck on the pad
flatter in trajectory, paddled down to long leg
slid through on middle and leg, blocked in front of mid-on off the back foot
he uses his feet and works it behind square on the leg side, past the short-leg fielder

short leg in the picture and he drops it. This was tossed up and drifts in, he lunges forward and lobs it just over short leg off the inner edge. The fielder (Sami Aslam I guess) gets both hands but can't hang on
straight ball at 90.1ks, defended
he has leathered the hell out of it. He runs down the track and whacks it over long-on
on a length and outside off, steered to sweeper cover
tossed up and full, he nips down the track and lofts it over the covers
Tamim chips down the track and defends it to off
pushed through, down the track and lifts it to long-off on the bounce
drifting down leg, he gets enough bat on the paddle, runs away to the long-leg boundary. Tamim reaches a fifty of his own
spins in on a back of a length, he hangs back and punches it to midwicket
flighted and outside off, he comes down the track and swings, slices it over to the long-off boundary
pushed through on middle, he comes forward to defend it
defended to short leg
fuller and outside off, dropped in front of the covers for a speedy single
back of a length on middle, he shuffles across and works it to the leg side

good length angled in on off, Tamim solidly blocks it to the covers with his bat-pad close together. Pakistan appeal for lbw, not given. They go for a review. The impact was front pad first, struck marginally outside off. Umpire's call prevails
back of a length outside off, down the track and carved over to third man
whoa! Sarkar nips down the track, manufactures a length ball, gets under it and sends it over the long-on boundary
back of a length on middle, he goes over a swipe and skies it, the ball lands in no-man's land over mid-on
back of a length again, angled in, dabbed to point
pushed through, he gets quickly into position and reverse-sweeps it to the third-man boundary
tossed up on middle, he uses his feet and drives it to long-on
flatter and on off, Tamim goes low and paddles it to long leg. He pushes it for two and they get it
darted quicker, Tamim aims for a slog sweep, gloves it very fine on the leg side. Beats short fine leg as well
flighted on the fourth-stump line, turned to midwicket
lobbed up on off, he stretches forward, dabs it in front of point. Looks for an urgent single before deciding against it
back of a length and straying on the hips. With fine leg up in the circle, you can't afford to bowl that. Pulled away backward of square leg
shortish as he comes down the track, aims for a pull. Miscues it over mid-on

Tamim Iqbal has been given out lbw, he goes for a review straightaway. This was fuller and angled in, Tamim is hit on the knee-roll of the front pad in front of off. Hawk-Eye shows that it would hit top of off. The on-field umpire's decision is vindicated. No hat-trick of centuries for Tamim. Nevertheless, he gets a standing ovation as he walks back
good length on middle and leg, blocked back to bowler
tight delivery curling away outside off past the nervy poke of Mahmudullah. His feet did not move there
he misses the defensive push and takes it on the thigh pad. Pitched outside leg
Sarkar goes low, fetches this from outside off and slog-sweeps to deep midwicket
drifts in, keeps low as well. Mahmudullah adjusts and defends it
pushed back to the bowler
quicker and on off, blocked
Mahmudullah looks to flick and takes it on the pad, sliding down
a big shout for lbw, the umpire shakes his head. Slid through quicker, he misses the defensive push but this was sliding down
back of a length and on off, he rocks back and drags a pull to midwicket
shortish from Junaid as he chips down the track. Swings and misses, no snick on that. I dunno why Rizwan was appealing for that
dug in on a shortish length and outside off, punched to the right of Nasim at sweeper cover
back of a length and outside off, forced to sweeper cover. Junaid oversteps in search of extra pace
length on off and middle, he clobbers it. Mahmudullah clears his front leg and swings it over midwicket with an unfettered followthrough, one-bounce four

Junaid takes out Mahmudullah. They check for a no-ball, this one is a legal one, though. Fullish and jags in on off, he seeks to drive it through the covers. The ball sneaks through the bat-pad gap and clatters the top of off
back of a length on middle and leg, he hops up and tucks it through backward square leg
angled in and turns away with extra bounce, defended past silly-point
tossed up, he comes forward and drives to the off side
angled in on off and spins away, dabbed past slip
slid through quicker on middle, blocked to silly-point
straighter on off, Mushfiq comes forward to defend it to silly-point, again
angled in outside off, laced to long-off for one
good length ball on middle, nudged through midwicket for one
fuller and angled in on middle, pushed to mid-on for a speedy single
fullish and angling away outside off, Mushfiq waits on it, opens the face of the bat and dabs it past Hafeez at slip. Delicately done by Mushfiq
length on off, bunted in front of the covers for a quick single
back of a length and outside off, not much rise on this. Sarkar fetches it from there and clubs it lustily over mid-on
this is even better! Length-delivery on off, Sarkar charges down the track and slaps it over the bowler's head for a dismissive four
flighted and outside off, chipped in front of Hafeez at extra-cover
fullish and around off, dead-batted by Mushfiq
looped up outside off, Mushfiq just about lifts it over Nasim at covers. He moves back, leaps in vain
flatter and Babur gets some turn, blocked
arm-ball arrows in with the angle, he gets an inside edge onto the pad. The ball rolls past silly-point
half-tracker outside off and Mushfiq must kick himself for not putting that away. Cuts and finds point
banged in short and outside off, Sarkar ramps it over to third man
back of a length, hurries on top of middle and off, blocked in front of covers
Mushfiq angles his bat on impact with this length-ball outside off and guides it to third man
short ball and it is dispatched. He rocks back in a flash to nail a pull over midwicket. The crowd loving this
change of pace at 102.7ks, much fuller and on off, mishit drive to mid-off
Wahab bends his back and delivers a short bumpy ball at 135ks, Sarkar semi- ducks and lets it fly through to Rizwan
angled in on off and turns away, blocked past silly-point
flighted on middle, Mushfiq comes down the track, meets the pitch of the ball and drives it imperiously past the covers
flighted on off, driven to long-off
looped up on the pads, nudged to square leg
short and outside off, he fetches it from there and punches it to long-on
flighted on off, Mushfiq lunges forward to defend, gets an inside edge that dribbles past short leg
legbreak outside off, patted to the covers
flighted and spins away close to off, poked to point
nicely flighted on middle and leg, jabbed to mid-on
skids off the deck, keeps low on off, Sarkar gets his bat down and gets an inside edge on the pad
tossed up nicely outside off with some extra bounce, leaving Sarkar prodding. Beaten, the keeper can't collect the ball cleanly. Looked like that was a googly

half-tracker and pummeled away! What a way to reach a century. He rocks back and pulls it powerfully over deep midwicket for a maiden ODI century. The fielder could do nothing but watch the ball go over. Sarkar is pumped
tossed up, poked to point
fullish on off, blocked back to the bowler
angled down leg, tickled away to the left of the keeper. No bat on that, should have been leg byes. The ball brushed the pad and sneaked away fine
lobbed up and turns away outside off, dabbed with soft hands to the left of slip
loopy legbreak, Mushfiq pokes at it, gets an outside edge, dies down in front of Hafeez and runs away through his legs
pushed through quicker, he sets up for a reverse sweep and misses as he is struck on the shoulder
back of a length and outside off, late-cut away to the left of backward point. Lovely timing and placement
back of a length and on off, Mushfiq gets right behind the line and blocks it
length and outside off, glided to deep third man
fuller and on middle, drilled past the non-striker, mid-off hunts the ball down, moving to his left
bouncer boings over the leg stump at 132.7ks, Sarkar can't hook it away. Superb take from Rizwan, though

Yikes, Junaid has shelled a simple catch. This was shortish and on leg, following Sarkar, who was making a bit of room. He connected with the pull. The ball pops in and pops out. Sloppy effort from Junaid at deep midwicket
length on middle, he uses his feet and slugs it away to long-on
back of a length and straight, turned to midwicket
drifts on the pads, tucked to midwicket
shortish and spinning outside leg, mishit pull to short fine
quicker at 94ks on middle and leg, he saunters down the track and thwacks it over long-off for another six
pushed through on the leg stump, he takes it on the pad. This was going down leg
on a length and outside off, steered away to third man with an angled bat
length on middle and leg, Sarkar drills it to the left of Umar Gul. The bowler had no chance. Sarkar is upping the ante after reaching three figures

resounding crack as he met the ball. Dragged short and wide outside off, he fetches it from there and smacks a pull to the cow corner boundary, bisecting the two men in the deep. It was the slower one at 119.3ks, but Sarkar manufactured his own pace
anddd again! Length ball, he nips down the track, unleashes an almighty swing and sends it soaring over long-on
length ball on middle and leg, slowy at 115ks, whipped away to long-on
fractionally back of a length and outside off, Mushfiq waits on it and guides it through the vacant slip cordon. Babar hauls the ball in the deep
shortish and outside off, he rides the bounce and guides it down to deep third man
length outside off, eased to third man with an open face
Sarkar makes room outside leg, Gul follows him. He adjusts and chops it towards third man
back of a length and outside off, use of finesse again as Mushfiq unfurls another nifty dab to third man
length outside off, Sarkar shuffles across off and manipulates it behind square leg with a flip of those wrists
pitched up and outside off, driven in front of mid-off for an urgent single
on a good length and angling away outside off, Mushfiq can't connect with the dab to third man now. Beaten
length on middle, Mushfiq skips down the track and drills it it over the bowler, it just scudded away to the boundary. To add to Pakistan's woes, Junaid has overstepped
free-hit. Mushfiq nips down the track, Junaid shortens his length outside off and delivers a bumpy ball, which is carved over backward point, third man runs to his right to mop it up in the deep

Bangladesh sweep the series 3-0! Mushfiq roars, has his hands aloft in joy and then hugs Sarkar. Beaming smiles in the Bangladesh camp. Junaid errs on the pads, tickled away to the right of short fine
